intro: Echinocactus mihanovichii, commonly known as the golden barrel cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical shape and bright yellow spines that give it its common name. The plant has a thick, ribbed stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Its flowers, which are typically yellow or orange, bloom in the spring and are relatively short-lived. Echinocactus mihanovichii is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
